alert.note: Alert for Hunterdon (New Jersey) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 22 at 3:42AM EDT until August 22 at 8:45AM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 645 AM EDT THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of northern New Jersey...and southeast Pennsylvania...including the following counties...in northern New Jersey...Hunterdon. In southeast Pennsylvania...Bucks. * WHEN...Until 645 AM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 342 AM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly across portions of the advisory area. Between 0.5 and 1 inch of rain has fallen. - Some locations that may experience flooding include... Doylestown, Flemington, High Bridge, Clinton, New Hope, Glen Gardner, Hampton, Stockton, Sand Brook, Sergeantsville, Lumberville, and Annandale. - This includes the following highways... Interstate 78 in New Jersey between mile markers 13 and 19. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
